answerText: pulse-chase experiments [or pulsed-chase experiment][10] Pulse-chase experiments were used by a pair of Japanese scientists to find these short strands of DNA on the lagging strand of a replication fork. They're about 100 nucleotides long in eukaryotes and are linked by ligases.
